channel.title: Cryptography on Nautilus
channel.description: Recent content in Cryptography on Nautilus

item.title: Analysis of Entropy Loss and Computational Security: PBKDF2 vs. Argon2id in WASM Environments
item.author: libretechsystems@placeq.com (Libretech Systems)
item.description: In the realm of modern cryptography, Password-Based Key Derivation Functions (KDFs) are essential for transforming human-readable passwords into high-entropy cryptographic keys. Two of the most prominent functions in use today are PBKDF2 (Password-Based Key Derivation Function 2) and Argon2id.
